deck: A story arc in Incredible Hulk - Hulk finds himself on an island that has much more too it than initially seems to be the case.
description:
Collected Editions

  • Incredible Hulk: Tempest Fugit

Summary

The Hulk finds himself unknowingly on Monster Island, where after walking for mile under water he finds himself forced to change back into Puny Banner. Banner is then rescued by Gwen and Ripley, two other people stranded on the island, the pair fend off a two head creature. Then Banner, Gwen and Rip are are confronted by the Gray Hulk.

The Gray Hulk recognizes Banner, and Banner is confused how the Hulk is loose. The three castaways make a run for it but when they come across a chasm, Banner transforms into the Hulk and helps Gwen and Rip escape and Banner-Hulk fights Gray Hulk. Banner-Hulk breaks Gray Hulks neck, and this is when he notices Gray Hulk turn into some sort of machine.

Banner-Hulk starts in investigate but he is attacked by Fin Fang Foom. Meanwhile Gwen and Rip are found by General Thunderbolt Ross. He explains they have washed up on a military base during an experiment and takes them to see, Dr. S. Yarish, but before the three can get safely inside the base, Ross is attacked by a three headed dog and drug away. Gwen chases after while Rip is taken inside by Dr. Yarish.

When Gwen finally finds Ross, the general drowns her, and back at the base, Dr. Yarish drugs Rip. Meanwhile, Banner-Hulk fights Fin Fang Foom, Wolverine, and Kang, before Banner announces he knows this is all fake and demands to see whose been doing it.

This is when Banner wakes up in a straight jacket and Doc Samson tells him that he has been dreaming that past few months and that he has been committed. Banner realizes this is a trick again and after facing a fake Mephisto Banner-Hulk is approached by Gwen, who is once again alive. She tells him this is the work of her father, Nightmare. Nightmare then appears and tells Banner-Hulk that Gwen is right and he brought Banner to Monster Island as revenge for what he did to him years ago.

Banner Hulk is prepared to leave but when Nightmare informs him that he used Betty Ross as he vessel for his daughter, Banner-Hulk rips off his head and takes his horse, and rides off the island.

Later, Betty washes up on the shore of Monster Island where she finds her father, who is really a nightmare made by Nightmare.

While this story goes on there is a story of Bruce in high school and about how he built a bomb that the Hulk set. It tells how Major Thaddeus Ross found Bruce for the Gamma Project to begin with.
name: Tempest Fugit

deck: 2013 Zenescope Event
description:
Zenescope Entertainment announced plans for a major Spring/Summer event entitled Unleashed. The release includes six separate mini-series and a total of 24 issues (some being oversized issues) that tie directly into the Grimm Fairy Tales Universe. The event will delve directly into the world of horror monsters while following those with the skills to hunt them. Grimm Fairy Tales Unleashed is the main seven issue mini-series that begins when hundreds of formerly trapped vampires, werewolves, demons and zombies are all released on Earth by a very powerful entity known as The Being. Four separate monster hunters must join forces along with Grimms heroine Sela Mathers in order to stop them.

The five other mini-series will lead directly into Unleashed and follow the terrifying stories of the monsters that exist within the Grimm Universe. The series are The Eternal (Vampires), The Unseen (Demons), The Hunger (Werewolves) and The Cursed (Zombies). The fifth series entitled The Hunters: Shadowlands follows those who are chosen to hunt these creatures, including Zenescopes reimagined Van Helsing.

Collected Editions

  • Grimm Fairy Tales Unleashed
  • Grimm Fairy Tales presents Hunters
  • Grimm Fairy Tales presents Vampires & Werewolves
  • Grimm Fairy Tales presents Zombies & Demons

deck: While the Avengers join forces with a cosmic armada to repel the Builders, Thanos takes advantage of their absence to lay siege to Earth.
description:
Description

Written by Jonathan Hickman and art by Jim Cheung, Infinity is a six part event beginning in August 2013. A preview issue was released for Free Comic Book Day 2013.

The series will center on the Avengers team heading out in to the galaxy to unite the major species of the galaxy the Kree, the Shi'ar, the Skrulls as well as many other species uniting them against the Builders. The Avengers will encounter the Guardians of the Galaxy and Nova (Sam Alexander) in space. While the Avengers are in space Thanos is going to be mucking about with Earth and the remaining heroes will be left to defend it.

Besides the main series there will be many tie-ins as follows:

  • Avengers - Focusing on the status of the Avengers in space;
  • Avengers Assemble
  • Captain Marvel
  • Fearless Defenders
  • Guardians of the Galaxy
  • Infinity: Heist
  • Infinity: The Hunt
  • Mighty Avengers
  • New Avengers - Focusing on what is going on on Earth;
  • Nova
  • Secret Avengers
  • Superior Spider-Man Team-Up
  • Thunderbolts
  • Wolverine & The X-Men Annual

Plot Summary

Free comic book day preview

On a distant planet a so called [Outriders|Outrider], a genetically produced assassin, returns to his master bearing a message about a planet known as Ahl-Agullo; another as yet unnamed alien asks someone if this pleases him, to which the shadowy figure says yes; the outrider then goes out to complete his mission. The alien, Corvus Glaive, appears on Ahl-Agullo demanding tribute of its king and mockingly displays the blade of its greatest warrior, the prince, revealing to the king he is dead. Corvus mentions that the last time his master came to this world it was burnt down;the king, convinced, gives him a tribute, and Corvus brings it to his master, Thanos, who is quite pleased with it.

The Outrider arrives on Earth and starts its search at Avengers Tower, The Jean Gray School For Higher Learning and the S.H.E.I.L.D Helicarrier.

Prelude to Infinity

Part One: The Signal (The Avengers #14; released in June 2013)

The Origin Sites - originally created by the Builders to take control over and transform Earth into something else - across the globe suddenly activate and sending out EMP signals (while cutting off the electricity on Earth) across the Marvel Universe every few minutes. What do these signals mean and who do they communicate with? It's up to the Avengers to stop this.

Part Two: Sent and Received (The Avengers #15; released in July 2013)

n/a

Part Two: To the End (The Avengers #16; released in July 2013)

n/a

Part Three: ....To the light (The Avengers #17; released in August 2013)

n/a

What Maximus Made (New Avengers #8; released in July 2013)

n/a

Infinity

The Illuminati are preparing to stop an incursion, and destroy a world (all of this is seen in New Avengers, and Black Panther destroys the world, stopping the incursion.

The Tribute

Originally printed in Free comic book day.

On a distant planet a so called [Outriders|Outrider], a genetically produced assassin, returns to his master bearing a message about a planet known as Ahl-Agullo; another as yet unnamed alien asks someone if this pleases him, to which the shadowy figure says yes; the outrider then goes out to complete his mission. The alien, Corvus Glaive, appears on Ahl-Agullo demanding tribute of its king and mockingly displays the blade of its greatest warrior, the prince, revealing to the king he is dead. Corvus mentions that the last time his master came to this world it was burnt down;the king, convinced, gives him a tribute, and Corvus brings it to his master, Thanos, who is quite pleased with it.

The Outrider arrives on earth and starts the search for what is still hidden. The Outrider is seen searching the Jean Gray School for Mutants, The Avengers Headquarters and the S.H.I.E.l.D helicarrier.

Constructing Apocalypse

Far away from Earth on the planet Galador it is under attack from the Builders, and the Alephs are razing the planet to the ground. People cower in fear in front of them, but they are saved by the Spaceknights who are the heroes of Galador. The Spaceknights begin to fight the Alephs and take most of them out, but not before Captain Universe appears, and tells two citizens of Galador that there is no hope even with the Spaceknights. The Builders then destroy the planet disintegrating everyone, and everything on it, including Captain Universe.

Orbital

Captain America and Hawkeye are in Palermo hunting down some Skrulls with the assistance of S.W.O.R.D. After a brief fight with the Skrulls after it turns out theyve disguised themselves as humans, the Skrulls are defeated. Captain Universe turns up on the Peak station unconscious.

What was hidden, now uncovered

The Outrider appears in Attilan the home of the Inhumans which is hovering above Manhattan. The Outrider gets into Black bolts mind and tries to find something in his mind. The outrider gathers information on the Inhumans, as well as the Illuminati who he finds out have lost the Infinity Gems. Black Bolt then forces the outrider out of his mind, and the Outrider escapes even after some fighting, and several dead Inhumans.

Ex Nihilo examines Captain Universe, and the Avengers see some footage of a world under the attack from the Builders, and the course of the Builders points them directly at Earth.

Outbound

The Avengers ready to fly into space, and fight the Builders, and help fight them with the other worlds in the universe, even though Ex Nihio and Abbys claim they cannot be stopped.

The Outrider returns to the ruins of Titan, and delivers his message to Corvus Glaive, and Thanos before having his head taken off, which is his purpose in life, to die. The Black Order are assembled including Corvus Glaive, Proxima Midnight, Black Dwarf, the Ebony Maw and Supergiant. Thanos says he wants to raid Earth, but people say he is mad, but Corvus Glaive tells Thanos that it has no Avengers, at which point he smiles.

deck: "Prey" is set during the early days of Batman's career as he is struggling to earn the trust of the public and form a working relationship with James Gordon, who is still just a police captain. The story revolves around a brilliant but disturbed psychologist named Hugo Strange, who forms a personal vendetta against Batman.
description:
The main nemesis of the story is Hugo Strange, a brilliant psychologist who holds a professional stake and a personal obsession in unraveling Batman's secrets, including his true identity. He foments a smear campaign to paint Batman as a dangerous madman, which causes Batman to question his own sanity as well as the plausibility of his mission.

Collected Edition

Batman: Prey
name: Prey

deck: A rocket crashes down in Metropolis carrying a Kryptonian youngster. Superman and Lois take him into their home and raise him as their own, but when the boy's real father, General Zod, arrives on Earth and demands his frightened son be turned over to him, Superman must join forces with Lex Luthor to save Metropolis from destruction.
description: A rocket lands in Metropolis containing a boy that Superman thinks is from Krypton. Along with figuring out that that means to him, Superman must protect young Christopher Kent, who has become the most valuable child on the planet thanks to his immense power. Lex Luthor has his sights on him, assembling his own team of villains to nab Christopher. It all leads to an action-packed finale, as Superman and the new Superman Revenge Squad -- Lex Luthor, Bizarro, the Parasite and Metallo -- take on General Zod, Ursa and Non in a battle for Metropolis, the future of Krypton and Christopher Kent!
name: Last Son
